intro: Senecio tamaensis, commonly known as Tama's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in temperate to cold climates. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Senecio tamaensis is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
